arm_group.description: Patients with severe sepsis or septic shock with acute renal failure and requirement of continuous veno-venous hemodialysis
Patients with severe sepsis or septic shock without acute renal failure and no requirement of continuous veno-venous hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock:
The cerebrovascular autoregulation is impaired in patients with severe sepsis and septic
      shock. A continuous veno-venous hemodialysis may improve impaired cerebrovascular
      autoregulation.

      Hypothesis: continuous hemodialysis recovers impaired cerebrovascular autoregulation in
      patients with acute severe sepsis and septic shock.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cerebrovascular Autoregulation in Sepsis, Influence of Renal Replacement Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  severe sepsis or septic shock

          -  adult patients

          -  possibility of transcranial Doppler ultrasound

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  traumatic brain injury

          -  known cerebrovascular diseases

          -  Infection of the brain

          -  chronic renal failure

          -  pregnancy
